review: I've been using the Fire TV Stick ever since Amazon came out with it and I got it for the $19.99 price. It's a nice little device that's in direct competition with Chromecast, Roku and products alike.Here are some pro's and con's:PRO- Plugs in to HDMI Port- Great amount of content through Amazon Prime- Syncs with your photos from Amazon Cloud Drive- Easy to use remoteCONS- FireTV Stick come with it's own power supply and cord that needs to be plugged in in order for it to work ( more wires everywhere)- The FireTV Stick sometimes lags like crazy- There is no restart option to reboot it (this sucks because in my experience, this thing crashes...ALOT) - Video from Netflix sometimes lags really bad, sometimes it buffers a lot. Interestingly, Amazon Prime videos have been working fine with no issues whatsoever.- The remote is only compatible with some games that are available through the app store- There is no option to set up multiple users so it can be used by multiple members of the family so they can only see content that they need- Even though the router for internet is right next to my TV where the FireTV Stick is plugged in, it constantly loses connection and I have to reconnect it back to the networkOverall, the device is good. I just feel like Amazon rushed the product. It would be more convenient to have a cable-less device like the Chromecast. Also, the lagging and buffering on Netflix is not due to the bandwidth issue at home, I can stream same movie from my PS3 with no buffering or lagging. Hope the second generation will at least adder
